column1: Applicants for nurse-midwife programs usually must be registered nurses and have at least 1 to 2 years of nursing experience.
These cases may include high-risk pregnancies and care for pregnant women who also have a chronic illness.
SCOPE OF PRACTICE The nurse-midwife is educated and trained to provide a broad range of health care services for women and newborns.
As with other advanced practice nurses, license requirements for CNMs can vary from state to state.
